intro: Senecio stenactis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved senecio, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It features narrow, linear leaves and produces small yellow flowers arranged in clusters. Senecio stenactis is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its hardy nature and attractive foliage.
